page.topic: Securing Your Database in Desktop Applications
page.description: Alpha Anywhere provides numerous ways for you to protect your desktop application design and the data in your database.

section.description: A good starting point when deciding what security measures to implement is to look at the [Startup Event Sequence].

section.title: Protecting Your Desktop Application Design
section.description: The best way to protect your application design is to:

case.description: Compile your scripts and functions into a binary .AEX file. This makes it impossible for someone to see their source code.

section.title: Controlling Access to Data
section.description: There are several ways to control access to the data in your database.

case.description: Require a master password to open the database
Create a list of authorized users with individual passwords
Create one or more groups of users
Assign privileges to application objects (tables, forms, etc.) to groups
Encrypt passwords and limit the number of login attempts
Run a script when Alpha Anywhere opens a database
Hide the Control Panel to prevent access to developer tools
Customize the menus and toolbars that appear to control access to tables, tools, and layouts
Encrypt tables to prevent them from being read by other programs
Password protect layouts (forms, browses, reports, etc.)
Run a script when Alpha Anywhere closes a database
Run a script after Alpha Anywhere closes a database
